name: ORG-CONTEXT Ontology (Context Hub)
description: Rich organizational context hub bridging ORG entities to domain-specific ontologies. Links products, brands, competitive landscape, market segments, and maturity assessment via the context hub pattern.

components.OrganizationContext: Central hub entity linking all contextual sub-entities for an organization
components.Product: Product or service offered by the organization to target market segments
components.Brand: Brand owned by the organization carrying its own market identity
components.ProductPortfolio: Structured view of complete product and service offerings
components.CompetitiveLandscape: Competitive environment with competitors, forces, and trends
components.Competitor: Named competitor organization with competitive analysis
components.CompetitiveForce: Porter-style competitive force analysing structural market pressure
components.Trend: Macro trend affecting the market landscape (PESTEL)
components.MarketContext: Market segments, geographic scope, and customer needs
components.MarketSegment: Target market segment defined by industry, geography, and priority
components.CustomerNeed: High-level customer need: jobs-to-be-done, pain points, value drivers
components.OrganizationMaturity: Multi-dimensional maturity assessment across size, value, marketing, tech, AI

crossOntology.name: contextForOrganization
crossOntology.purpose: ORG → ORG-CONTEXT: Organizations receive rich context via bridge pattern

crossOntology.name: hasValueProposition
crossOntology.purpose: ORG-CONTEXT → VSOM: Context references value propositions defined in VSOM

crossOntology.name: brandValueProposition
crossOntology.purpose: ORG-CONTEXT → VSOM: Brand-level value proposition reference

crossOntology.name: productValueProposition
crossOntology.purpose: ORG-CONTEXT → VSOM: Product-level value proposition reference
